learning_outcomes.description: Implement object-oriented programs according to their specifications.
Design, implement and document object-oriented programs using language features such as inheritance, interfaces, polymorphism, exceptions and I/O.
Design and implement test components for object-oriented programs.
Analyse code to judge whether it follows good programming practice.
Write, interpret and critique specifications for program modules (e.g. classes or interfaces).

assessments.due_date:
Week 2 Tue - Week 13 Tue

The due date and time will be 1:00pm each Tuesday, commencing week 2 unless otherwise indicated.
assessments.task_description:
You will be given sets of simple practical Java programming problems to solve during the semester. These problem sets will be delivered and submitted via the ShiFoo online environment. Each set of problems will reinforce concepts delivered in the course. In addition to implementing solutions to the problems, the problems may include components of reviewing code quality. Refer to the assessment description on Blackboard.

A link to this environment is available on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: These problem sets will be delivered and submitted via the ShiFoo online environment. A link to this environment is available on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Assignments are used to assess the practical skills of students on non-trivial, but reasonably well-defined problems.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online via Gradescope unless otherwise specified for a particular assessment item. Details will be provided with the assignment specification.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The exam will be similar in format to previous semesters and will cover all course content. You may use past exams as practice questions.
